title: Churchillvv
author: Churchillvv
content: I stumbled found this topic, which I believe may be beneficial to other people, including my fellow newbies. Additionally, I think it need to be tagged for novices to read for a better comprehension of the content. I also want to express my gratitude to everyone who contributed to the creation of that powerful thread, especially @Yogi.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=126798.0

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: Churchillvv on April 24, 2023, 07:33:48 PMI also want to express my gratitude to everyone who contributed to the creation of that powerful thread, especially @Yogi.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=126798.0That thread was not locked so you can show your gratitude better by commenting directly in that topic.Some sourcesCoinmarketcap Cryptocurrency Glossary: https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/glossaryCoingecko Cryptocurrency Glossary: https://www.coingecko.com/en/glossaryAfter the topic of Yogi, many members made their threads for Terminology.Quote from: Ratimov on October 07, 2021, 10:51:27 AMA-Z Mini Cryptocurrency Dictionary (by AdoboCandies)Ethosâ€™ Alphabetical Guide to Cryptocurrency Definitions and Metrics (by bitmover)A few cryptocurrency abbreviation (by COOLCRYPTOVATOR)Definition of some short Abbreviations used on forum. comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: Quote That thread was not locked so you can show your gratitude better by commenting directly in that topic.Yes I should have done that.  NotedQuoteAfter the topic of Yogi, many members made their threads for Terminology.Quote from: Ratimov on October 07, 2021, 10:51:27 AMA-Z Mini Cryptocurrency Dictionary (by AdoboCandies)Ethosâ€™ Alphabetical Guide to Cryptocurrency Definitions and Metrics (by bitmover)A few cryptocurrency abbreviation (by COOLCRYPTOVATOR)Definition of some short Abbreviations used on forum. Everyone should know; (by COOLCRYPTOVATOR)Crypto acronyms and their meanings for beginners (CHECK OUT) (by CryptoHeadlineNews)ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥Blockchain entry series / 1ï¼š50 Blockchain TermsðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ (by Dalong Wallet)READ THIS if you just landed here. (by fernandoaleixo)The beginners guide to Blockchain & Cryptocurrency (by mikeey89)A Reminder To Newbies! (by nakamura12)Important terms that are frequently confused. (by odolvlobo)Cryptocurrency Lingo/Slang (by theyoungmillionaire)Terminology (by yogi)I have a question for you. How long have you been a member of this forum before discovering those threads? I wanted to post a helpful topic that I had seen that would be helpful to other beginners. Why didn't you let newbies know about the list you dropped here? How confident are you that new users will locate and read those threads?Because of this, I proposed that it be labeled. If a moderator thinks this topic is important, he or she can compile a comprehensive list of acronyms and Bitcointalk.org phrases.

comments.author: Cynthia_sinach042
comments.body: They are lots of helpful threads on terminology and also guides in the forum, anyone who wishes for more insights should make sure they activate the search buttonHere is one very useful guide topic that has helped me https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5275357.0Also make sure to check out the reply from tranthidung it was very helpful.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Churchillvv on April 25, 2023, 12:14:56 PMI have a question for you. How long have you been a member of this forum before discovering those threads? <snip>You seem to have not gotten the advice in the reply you quoted. Tha user was asking that you can also bump that particular thread you're linking to, but doing that it comes to the top page of the board again and those yet to see it would be able to find it easily. Jus follow the bump rules of 1 per every 24 hours and to delete old bumps.The user also listed other useful threads still to make it easier for new members to find it easily and read through.
